page.title: 18THE THREE RIVERS
page.content: There are three rivers in the area in deep wooded valleys.The biggest one is the{Tamar}then the{Tavy }and the smallest is the {Walkham.} The {Tavy }and the{Walkham }meet at{Double Waters}where there is a good place to swim.The{Tavy}joins the{Tamar at{Bere Ferrers}and the{Tamar }goes down to the sea at {Plymouth.} In winter when the rivers flood the {Tamar}floods {Morwellham }and the water comes into some of the buildings there.At {Double Waters}the rivers are very rough and dangerous. Ships used to sail up the {Tamar } to{Morwellham}but now the river is too shallow for anything big though some pleasure boats can get there at high tide.
